The Technology Partner Network, built by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, is a group of “invite-only” global technology experts assembled as collaborative advisors and resources to accelerated tech-related solutions for global good. + TPN Advisors collaborate with program officers and grantees from The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and its partners to provide strategic guidance, tactical support, or quick answers related to technology-dependent investments.+ The Technology Partner Network is comprised of recognized leaders from technology, data, and delivery companies as well as NGOs and non-profits across the globe.

Moderator and Panelist:Risk and Resilience (Annual Meeting 2011, Davos)Technology in the Developing World (Annual Meeting of the New Champions 2011, China)Social and Technological Models (Annual Meeting 2013, Davos)Culture as an Agent for Change (World Economic Forum on the Middle East, North Africa and Eurasia 2012)Decoding the Digital Gender Divide (Annual Meeting 2013, Davos)Member, Global Agenda Council: Data-Driven Development & Personal Data Initiative
Moderator: Education and EmploymentCommitment: NetHope Academy

Research shows that diseases such as chronic pain and depression are actually symptoms of a neuroinflammatory disease - the result of an underlying inflammation in the brain. The Foundation for Total Recovery - a leader in the search for a cure for neuroinflammatory disease - believes that through dedicated research and education, we can provide a personal, integrated approach to relieving pain, identifying a legitimate path to healing and recovery for those in need.

November 23, 2014, Richard reported directly to Bill

Dr. Brindley has been a colleague and manager of several professional activities for which I had senior financial responsibility over the past 10+ years. He excels in developing relationships and producing dynamic and timely results. As a chief executive, he met the challenges of a complexity of diverse personalities and agendas of his respective boards, while never losing sight of the mission of the organization.He is ethical, thoughtful and knows how to find opportunities. He is a very exciting partner and I have been most fortunate to have shared such experiences with him.

During my seven years serving as CEO of NetHope, I’ve often had the pleasure of working directly with Adam in his role as Vice Chairman and Head of the Personnel Committee. Adam's wise counsel was invaluable to me when navigating the nuances of delivering value to members in an organization with diverse interests and multiple activities. What impresses me the most about Adam is his sound judgment, knowledge, collaborative nature and sense of fairness. His executive experience in both the corporate and social benefit sectors makes him an excellent addition to any senior management team.

summary: Bill Brindley is a veteran multi-sector executive leader with a track record of success in global corporations, social enterprises and family businesses. His executive positions include: Chief Executive Officer, President, Global Managing Director, Chief Operating Officer and Chief Information Officer. He has held senior executive positions at Citigroup, Prudential and NetHope. His diverse background includes starting, turning around and leading social benefit, entertainment and commercial enterprises.Bill has helped launch and grow two new foundations, in medicine and music. He has served as an advisor to the Bill & Melinda Gates Technology Partner Network, the World Economic Forum and numerous other social and commercial enterprises.He is a frequent speaker, moderator and panelist at venues such as the World Economic Forum, the Clinton Global Initiative and the Social Innovation Summit. Additionally,  Bill publishes regularly in the Stanford Social Innovation Review, the World Economic Forum Blog and the Huffington Post.Bill often participates in media interviews and events with CNN, BBC, Facebook Live, World Economic Forum, Clinton Global Initiative, Radio Active, Warner Cable and other venues. He graduated with highest honors from American University and holds several graduate degrees including a doctorate in organizational renewal. Bill is also a graduate of the Wharton Advanced Management Program and completed additional postgraduate work at Columbia and Harvard Business Schools.Specialties: Executive leadership, business development, marketing and sales, fund raising, philanthropy, emerging markets, international development, information and communications technology, financial services, social enterprise, organizational renewal and entertainment.
